026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets;
027
028import java.util.Arrays;
029import java.util.EnumSet;
030import java.util.HashMap;
031import java.util.HashSet;
032import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
033import java.util.LinkedList;
034import java.util.List;
035import java.util.Locale;
036import java.util.Map;
037import java.util.Optional;
038import java.util.Set;
039
040import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
041import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
042import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
043import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
044import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
045import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
046import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
047import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
048import javax.lang.model.type.ExecutableType;
049import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
050import javax.lang.model.util.Types;
051
052import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.ContentBuilder;
053import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
054import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
055import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFinder;
056import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.Utils;
057import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFinder.Result;
058
059import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
060import com.sun.source.doctree.ThrowsTree;
061
062import jdk.javadoc.doclet.Taglet.Location;
063
064/**
065 * A taglet that processes {@link ThrowsTree}, which represents {@code @throws}
066 * and {@code @exception} tags, collectively referred to as exception tags.
067 */
068public class ThrowsTaglet extends BaseTaglet implements InheritableTaglet {
069
070    /*
071     * Relevant bits from JLS
072     * ======================
073     *
074     * This list is _incomplete_ because some parts cannot be summarized here
075     * and require careful reading of JLS.
076     *
077     * 11.1.1 The Kinds of Exceptions
078     *
079     * Throwable and all its subclasses are, collectively, the exception
080     * classes.
081     *
082     * 8.4.6 Method Throws
083     *
084     * Throws:
085     * throws ExceptionTypeList
086     *
087     * ExceptionTypeList:
088     * ExceptionType {, ExceptionType}
089     *
090     * ExceptionType:
091     * ClassType
092     * TypeVariable
093     *
094     * It is a compile-time error if an ExceptionType mentioned in a throws
095     * clause is not a subtype (4.10) of Throwable.
096     *
097     * Type variables are allowed in a throws clause even though they are
098     * not allowed in a catch clause (14.20).
099     *
100     * It is permitted but not required to mention unchecked exception
101     * classes (11.1.1) in a throws clause.
102     *
103     * 8.1.2 Generic Classes and Type Parameters
104     *
105     * It is a compile-time error if a generic class is a direct or indirect
106     * subclass of Throwable.
107     *
108     * 8.8.5. Constructor Throws
109     *
110     * The throws clause for a constructor is identical in structure and
111     * behavior to the throws clause for a method (8.4.6).
112     *
113     * 8.8. Constructor Declarations
114     *
115     * Constructor declarations are ... never inherited and therefore are not
116     * subject to hiding or overriding.
117     *
118     * 8.4.4. Generic Methods
119     *
120     * A method is generic if it declares one or more type variables (4.4).
121     * These type variables are known as the type parameters of the method.
122     *
123     * ...
124     *
125     * Two methods or constructors M and N have the same type parameters if
126     * both of the following are true:
127     *
128     * - M and N have same number of type parameters (possibly zero).
129     * ...
130     *
131     * 8.4.2. Method Signature
132     *
133     * Two methods or constructors, M and N, have the same signature if they
134     * have ... the same type parameters (if any) (8.4.4) ...
135     * ...
136     * The signature of a method m1 is a subsignature of the signature of
137     * a method m2 if either:
138     *
139     * - m2 has the same signature as m1, or
140     * - the signature of m1 is the same as the erasure (4.6) of the
141     * signature of m2.
142     *
143     * Two method signatures m1 and m2 are override-equivalent iff either
144     * m1 is a subsignature of m2 or m2 is a subsignature of m1.
145     *
146     * 8.4.8.1. Overriding (by Instance Methods)
147     *
148     * An instance method mC declared in or inherited by class C, overrides
149     * from C another method mA declared in class A, iff all of the following
150     * are true:
151     *
152     * ...
153     * - The signature of mC is a subsignature (8.4.2) of the signature of
154     * mA as a member of the supertype of C that names A.
155     */
156
157    public ThrowsTaglet(BaseConfiguration configuration) {
158        // of all language elements only constructors and methods can declare
159        // thrown exceptions and, hence, document them
160        super(DocTree.Kind.THROWS, false,
161            EnumSet.of(Location.CONSTRUCTOR, Location.METHOD));
162        this.configuration = configuration;
163        this.utils = this.configuration.utils;
164    }
165
166    private final BaseConfiguration configuration;
167    private final Utils utils;
168
169    @Override
170    public Output inherit(Element owner, DocTree tag, boolean isFirstSentence,
171            BaseConfiguration configuration) {
172        // This method shouldn't be called because {@inheritDoc} tags inside
173        // exception tags aren't dealt with individually. {@inheritDoc} tags
174        // inside exception tags are collectively dealt with in
175        // getAllBlockTagOutput.
176        throw newAssertionError(owner, tag, isFirstSentence);
177    }
178
179    @Override
180    public Content getAllBlockTagOutput(Element holder, TagletWriter writer) {
181        try {
182            return getAllBlockTagOutput0(holder, writer);
183        } catch (Failure f) {
184            // note that `f.holder()` is not necessarily the same as `holder`
185            var ch = utils.getCommentHelper(f.holder());
186            var messages = configuration.getMessages();
187            if (f instanceof Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound e) {
188                var path = ch.getDocTreePath(e.tag().getExceptionName());
189                messages.warning(path, "doclet.throws.reference_not_found");
190            } else if (f instanceof Failure.NotExceptionType e) {
191                var path = ch.getDocTreePath(e.tag().getExceptionName());
192                // output the type we found to help the user diagnose the issue
193                messages.warning(path, "doclet.throws.reference_bad_type",
194                    diagnosticDescriptionOf(e.type()));
195            } else if (f instanceof Failure.Invalid e) {
196                messages.error(ch.getDocTreePath(e.tag()),
197                    "doclet.inheritDocWithinInappropriateTag");
198            } else if (f instanceof Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter e) {
199                var path = ch.getDocTreePath(e.tag().getExceptionName());
200                messages.warning(path, "doclet.throwsInheritDocUnsupported");
201            } else if (f instanceof Failure.Undocumented e) {
202                messages.warning(ch.getDocTreePath(e.tag()),
203                    "doclet.inheritDocNoDoc",
204                    diagnosticDescriptionOf(e.exceptionElement));
205            } else {
206                // TODO: instead of if-else, use pattern matching for switch for
207                // both
208                // readability and exhaustiveness when it's available
209                throw newAssertionError(f);
210            }
211        } catch (DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound e) {
212            // since {@inheritDoc} in @throws is processed by ThrowsTaglet (this
213            // taglet) rather than
214            // InheritDocTaglet, we have to duplicate some of the behavior of
215            // the latter taglet
216            String signature = utils.getSimpleName(holder)
217                + utils.flatSignature((ExecutableElement) holder,
218                    writer.getCurrentPageElement());
219            configuration.getMessages().warning(holder, "doclet.noInheritedDoc",
220                signature);
221        }
222        return writer.getOutputInstance(); // TODO: consider invalid rather than
223                                           // empty output
224    }
225
226    private Content getAllBlockTagOutput0(Element holder,
227            TagletWriter writer)
228            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound,
229            Failure.NotExceptionType,
230            Failure.Invalid,
231            Failure.Undocumented,
232            Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter,
233            DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound {
234        ElementKind kind = holder.getKind();
235        if (kind != ElementKind.METHOD && kind != ElementKind.CONSTRUCTOR) {
236            // Elements are processed by applicable taglets only. This taglet
237            // is only applicable to executable elements such as methods
238            // and constructors.
239            throw newAssertionError(holder, kind);
240        }
241        var executable = (ExecutableElement) holder;
242        ExecutableType instantiatedType = utils.asInstantiatedMethodType(
243            writer.getCurrentPageElement(), executable);
244        List<? extends TypeMirror> substitutedExceptionTypes
245            = instantiatedType.getThrownTypes();
246        List<? extends TypeMirror> originalExceptionTypes
247            = executable.getThrownTypes();
248        Map<TypeMirror,
249                TypeMirror> typeSubstitutions = getSubstitutedThrownTypes(
250                    utils.typeUtils,
251                    originalExceptionTypes,
252                    substitutedExceptionTypes);
253        var exceptionSection = new ExceptionSectionBuilder(writer);
254        // Step 1: Document exception tags
255        Set<TypeMirror> alreadyDocumentedExceptions = new HashSet<>();
256        List<ThrowsTree> exceptionTags = utils.getThrowsTrees(executable);
257        for (ThrowsTree t : exceptionTags) {
258            Element exceptionElement = getExceptionType(t, executable);
259            outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(exceptionSection, exceptionElement, t,
260                executable, alreadyDocumentedExceptions, typeSubstitutions,
261                writer);
262        }
263        // Step 2: Document exception types from the `throws` clause (of a
264        // method)
265        //
266        // While methods can be inherited and overridden, constructors can be
267        // neither of those (JLS 8.8).
268        // Therefore, it's only methods that participate in Step 2, which is
269        // about inheriting exception
270        // documentation from ancestors.
271        if (executable.getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD) {
272            for (TypeMirror exceptionType : substitutedExceptionTypes) {
273                Element exceptionElement
274                    = utils.typeUtils.asElement(exceptionType);
275                Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> r;
276                try {
277                    r = expandShallowly(exceptionElement, executable);
278                } catch (Failure | DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound e) {
279                    // Ignore errors here because unlike @throws tags, the
280                    // `throws` clause is implicit
281                    // documentation inheritance. It triggers a best-effort
282                    // attempt to inherit
283                    // documentation. If there are errors in ancestors, they
284                    // will likely be caught
285                    // once those ancestors are documented.
286                    continue;
287                }
288                if (r.isEmpty()) {
289                    // `exceptionType` is not documented by any tags from
290                    // ancestors, skip it till Step 3
291                    continue;
292                }
293                if (!alreadyDocumentedExceptions.add(exceptionType)) {
294                    // it expands to something that has to have been documented
295                    // on Step 1, skip
296                    continue;
297                }
298                for (Map.Entry<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> e : r
299                    .entrySet()) {
300                    outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(exceptionSection,
301                        exceptionElement, e.getKey(), e.getValue(),
302                        alreadyDocumentedExceptions, typeSubstitutions, writer);
303                }
304            }
305        }
306        // Step 3: List those exceptions from the `throws` clause for which no
307        // documentation was found on Step 2
308        for (TypeMirror e : substitutedExceptionTypes) {
309            if (!alreadyDocumentedExceptions.add(e)) {
310                continue;
311            }
312            exceptionSection.beginEntry(e);
313            // this JavaDoc warning is similar to but different from that of
314            // DocLint:
315            // dc.missing.throws = no @throws for {0}
316            // TODO: comment out for now and revisit later;
317            // commented out because of the generated noise for
318            // readObject/writeObject for serialized-form.html:
319            // exceptionSection.continueEntry(writer.invalidTagOutput(configuration.getDocResources().getText("doclet.throws.undocumented",
320            // e), Optional.empty()));
321            // configuration.getMessages().warning(holder,
322            // "doclet.throws.undocumented", e);
323            exceptionSection.endEntry();
324        }
325        assert alreadyDocumentedExceptions
326            .containsAll(substitutedExceptionTypes);
327        return exceptionSection.build();
328    }
329
330    private void outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(
331            ExceptionSectionBuilder exceptionSection,
332            Element originalExceptionElement,
333            ThrowsTree tag,
334            ExecutableElement holder,
335            Set<TypeMirror> alreadyDocumentedExceptions,
336            Map<TypeMirror, TypeMirror> typeSubstitutions,
337            TagletWriter writer)
338            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound,
339            Failure.NotExceptionType,
340            Failure.Invalid,
341            Failure.Undocumented,
342            Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter,
343            DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound {
344        outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(exceptionSection, originalExceptionElement,
345            tag, holder, true, alreadyDocumentedExceptions, typeSubstitutions,
346            writer);
347    }
348
349    private void outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(
350            ExceptionSectionBuilder exceptionSection,
351            Element originalExceptionElement,
352            ThrowsTree tag,
353            ExecutableElement holder,
354            boolean beginNewEntry,
355            Set<TypeMirror> alreadyDocumentedExceptions,
356            Map<TypeMirror, TypeMirror> typeSubstitutions,
357            TagletWriter writer)
358            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound,
359            Failure.NotExceptionType,
360            Failure.Invalid,
361            Failure.Undocumented,
362            Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter,
363            DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound {
364        var originalExceptionType = originalExceptionElement.asType();
365        var exceptionType = typeSubstitutions
366            .getOrDefault(originalExceptionType, originalExceptionType); // FIXME:
367                                                                         // ugh..........
368        alreadyDocumentedExceptions.add(exceptionType);
369        var description = tag.getDescription();
370        int i = indexOfInheritDoc(tag, holder);
371        if (i == -1) {
372            // Since the description does not contain {@inheritDoc}, we either
373            // add a new entry, or
374            // append to the current one. Here's an example of when we add a new
375            // entry:
376            //
377            // ... -> {@inheritDoc} -> <text>
378            //
379            // And here's an example of when we append to the current entry:
380            //
381            // ... -> <text> {@inheritDoc} <text> -> <text>
382
383            // if we don't need to add a new entry, assume it has been added
384            // before
385            assert exceptionSection.debugEntryBegun() || beginNewEntry;
386            if (beginNewEntry) { // add a new entry?
387                // originalExceptionElement might be different from that that
388                // triggers this entry: for example, a
389                // renamed exception-type type parameter
390                exceptionSection.beginEntry(exceptionType);
391            }
392            // append to the current entry
393            exceptionSection
394                .continueEntry(writer.commentTagsToOutput(holder, description));
395            if (beginNewEntry) { // if added a new entry, end it
396                exceptionSection.endEntry();
397            }
398        } else { // expand a single {@inheritDoc}
399            assert holder.getKind() == ElementKind.METHOD : holder.getKind(); // only
400                                                                              // methods
401                                                                              // can
402                                                                              // use
403                                                                              // {@inheritDoc}
404            // Is the {@inheritDoc} that we found standalone (i.e. without
405            // preceding and following text)?
406            boolean loneInheritDoc = description.size() == 1;
407            assert !loneInheritDoc || i == 0 : i;
408            boolean add = !loneInheritDoc && beginNewEntry;
409            // we add a new entry if the {@inheritDoc} that we found has
410            // something else around
411            // it and we can add a new entry (as instructed by the parent call)
412            if (add) {
413                exceptionSection.beginEntry(exceptionType);
414            }
415            if (i > 0) {
416                // if there's anything preceding {@inheritDoc}, assume an entry
417                // has been added before
418                assert exceptionSection.debugEntryBegun();
419                Content beforeInheritDoc = writer.commentTagsToOutput(holder,
420                    description.subList(0, i));
421                exceptionSection.continueEntry(beforeInheritDoc);
422            }
423            Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> tags;
424            try {
425                tags = expandShallowly(originalExceptionElement, holder);
426            } catch (Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter e) {
427                // repack to fill in missing tag information
428                throw new Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter(e.element, tag,
429                    holder);
430            }
431            if (tags.isEmpty()) {
432                throw new Failure.Undocumented(tag, holder,
433                    originalExceptionElement);
434            }
435            // if {@inheritDoc} is the only tag in the @throws description and
436            // this call can add new entries to the exception section,
437            // so can the recursive call
438            boolean addNewEntryRecursively = beginNewEntry && !add;
439            if (!addNewEntryRecursively && tags.size() > 1) {
440                // current tag has more to description than just {@inheritDoc}
441                // and thus cannot expand to multiple tags;
442                // it's likely a documentation error
443                throw new Failure.Invalid(tag, holder);
444            }
445            for (Map.Entry<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> e : tags.entrySet()) {
446                outputAnExceptionTagDeeply(exceptionSection,
447                    originalExceptionElement, e.getKey(), e.getValue(),
448                    addNewEntryRecursively, alreadyDocumentedExceptions,
449                    typeSubstitutions, writer);
450            }
451            // this might be an empty list, which is fine
452            if (!loneInheritDoc) {
453                Content afterInheritDoc = writer.commentTagsToOutput(holder,
454                    description.subList(i + 1, description.size()));
455                exceptionSection.continueEntry(afterInheritDoc);
456            }
457            if (add) {
458                exceptionSection.endEntry();
459            }
460        }
461    }
462
463    private static int indexOfInheritDoc(ThrowsTree tag,
464            ExecutableElement holder)
465            throws Failure.Invalid {
466        var description = tag.getDescription();
467        int i = -1;
468        for (var iterator = description.listIterator(); iterator.hasNext();) {
469            DocTree t = iterator.next();
470            if (t.getKind() == DocTree.Kind.INHERIT_DOC) {
471                if (i != -1) {
472                    // an exception tag description contains more than one
473                    // {@inheritDoc};
474                    // we consider it nonsensical and, hence, a documentation
475                    // error
476                    throw new Failure.Invalid(t, holder);
477                }
478                i = iterator.previousIndex();
479            }
480        }
481        return i;
482    }
483
484    private Element getExceptionType(ThrowsTree tag, ExecutableElement holder)
485            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound, Failure.NotExceptionType {
486        Element e = utils.getCommentHelper(holder).getException(tag);
487        if (e == null) {
488            throw new Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound(tag, holder);
489        }
490        // translate to a type mirror to perform a subtype test, which covers
491        // not only
492        // classes (e.g. class X extends Exception) but also type variables
493        // (e.g. <X extends Exception>)
494        var t = e.asType();
495        var subtypeTestInapplicable = switch (t.getKind()) {
496        case EXECUTABLE, PACKAGE, MODULE -> true;
497        default -> false;
498        };
499        if (subtypeTestInapplicable
500            || !utils.typeUtils.isSubtype(t, utils.getThrowableType())) {
501            // Aside from documentation errors, this condition might arise if
502            // the
503            // source cannot be compiled or element we found is not what the
504            // documentation author intended. Whatever the reason is (e.g.
505            // see 8295543), we should not process such an element.
506            throw new Failure.NotExceptionType(tag, holder, e);
507        }
508        var k = e.getKind();
509        assert k == ElementKind.CLASS || k == ElementKind.TYPE_PARAMETER : k; // JLS
510                                                                              // 8.4.6
511        return e;
512    }
513
514    @SuppressWarnings("serial")
515    private static sealed class Failure extends Exception {
516
517        private final DocTree tag;
518        private final ExecutableElement holder;
519
520        Failure(DocTree tag, ExecutableElement holder) {
521            super();
522            this.tag = tag;
523            this.holder = holder;
524        }
525
526        DocTree tag() {
527            return tag;
528        }
529
530        ExecutableElement holder() {
531            return holder;
532        }
533
534        static final class ExceptionTypeNotFound extends Failure {
535
536            ExceptionTypeNotFound(ThrowsTree tag, ExecutableElement holder) {
537                super(tag, holder);
538            }
539
540            @Override
541            ThrowsTree tag() {
542                return (ThrowsTree) super.tag();
543            }
544        }
545
546        static final class NotExceptionType extends Failure {
547
548            private final Element type;
549
550            public NotExceptionType(ThrowsTree tag, ExecutableElement holder,
551                    Element type) {
552                super(tag, holder);
553                this.type = type;
554            }
555
556            Element type() {
557                return type;
558            }
559
560            @Override
561            ThrowsTree tag() {
562                return (ThrowsTree) super.tag();
563            }
564        }
565
566        static final class Invalid extends Failure {
567
568            public Invalid(DocTree tag, ExecutableElement holder) {
569                super(tag, holder);
570            }
571        }
572
573        static final class Undocumented extends Failure {
574
575            private final Element exceptionElement;
576
577            public Undocumented(DocTree tag, ExecutableElement holder,
578                    Element exceptionElement) {
579                super(tag, holder);
580                this.exceptionElement = exceptionElement;
581            }
582        }
583
584        static final class UnsupportedTypeParameter extends Failure {
585
586            private final Element element;
587
588            // careful: tag might be null
589            public UnsupportedTypeParameter(Element element, ThrowsTree tag,
590                    ExecutableElement holder) {
591                super(tag, holder);
592                this.element = element;
593            }
594
595            @Override
596            ThrowsTree tag() {
597                return (ThrowsTree) super.tag();
598            }
599        }
600    }
601
602    /*
603     * Returns immediately inherited tags that document the provided exception
604     * type.
605     *
606     * A map associates a doc tree with its holder element externally. Such maps
607     * have defined iteration order of entries, whose keys and values
608     * are non-null.
609     */
610    private Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> expandShallowly(
611            Element exceptionType,
612            ExecutableElement holder)
613            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound,
614            Failure.NotExceptionType,
615            Failure.Invalid,
616            Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter,
617            DocFinder.NoOverriddenMethodsFound {
618        ElementKind kind = exceptionType.getKind();
619        DocFinder.Criterion<Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement>,
620                Failure> criterion;
621        if (kind == ElementKind.CLASS) {
622            criterion = method -> {
623                var tags = findByTypeElement(exceptionType, method);
624                return toResult(exceptionType, method, tags);
625            };
626        } else {
627            // Type parameters declared by a method are matched by position; the
628            // basis for
629            // such position matching is JLS sections 8.4.2 and 8.4.4. We don't
630            // match
631            // type parameters not declared by a method (e.g. declared by the
632            // enclosing class or interface) because
633            criterion = method -> {
634                // TODO: add a test for the throws clause mentioning
635                // a type parameter which is not declared by holder
636                int i = holder.getTypeParameters()
637                    .indexOf((TypeParameterElement) exceptionType);
638                if (i == -1) { // the type parameter is not declared by `holder`
639                    throw new Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter(exceptionType,
640                        null /* don't know if tag-related */, holder);
641                }
642                // if one method overrides the other, then those methods must
643                // have the same number of type parameters (JLS 8.4.2)
644                assert utils.elementUtils.overrides(holder, method,
645                    (TypeElement) holder.getEnclosingElement());
646                var typeParameterElement = method.getTypeParameters().get(i);
647                var tags = findByTypeElement(typeParameterElement, method);
648                return toResult(exceptionType, method, tags);
649            };
650        }
651        Result<Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement>> result;
652        try {
653            result = utils.docFinder().trySearch(holder, criterion);
654        } catch (Failure.NotExceptionType
655                | Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound
656                | Failure.UnsupportedTypeParameter x) {
657            // Here's why we do this ugly exception processing: the language
658            // does not allow us to
659            // instantiate the exception type parameter in criterion with a
660            // union of specific
661            // exceptions (i.e. Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound |
662            // Failure.NotExceptionType),
663            // so we instantiate it with a general Failure. We then refine the
664            // specific
665            // exception being thrown, from the general exception we caught.
666            throw x;
667        } catch (Failure f) {
668            throw newAssertionError(f);
669        }
670        if (result instanceof Result.Conclude<
671                Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement>> c) {
672            return c.value();
673        }
674        return Map.of(); // an empty map is effectively ordered
675    }
676
677    private static Result<Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement>> toResult(
678            Element target,
679            ExecutableElement holder,
680            List<ThrowsTree> tags) {
681        if (!tags.isEmpty()) {
682            // if there are tags for the target exception type, conclude search
683            // successfully
684            return Result.CONCLUDE(toExceptionTags(holder, tags));
685        }
686        return Result.CONTINUE();
687// TODO: reintroduce this back for JDK-8295800:
688//        if (holder.getThrownTypes().contains(target.asType())) {
689//            // if there are no tags for the target exception type, BUT that type is
690//            // mentioned in the `throws` clause, continue search
691//            return Result.CONTINUE();
692//        }
693//        // there are no tags for the target exception type AND that type is not
694//        // mentioned in the `throws` clause, skip search on the remaining part
695//        // of the current branch of the hierarchy
696//        // TODO: expand on this and add a test in JDK-8295800;
697//        //  for both checked and unchecked exceptions
698//        return Result.SKIP();
699    }
700
701    /*
702     * Associates exception tags with their holder.
703     *
704     * Such a map is used as a data structure to pass around methods that output
705     * tags to content.
706     */
707    private static Map<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement> toExceptionTags(
708            ExecutableElement holder,
709            List<ThrowsTree> tags) {
710        // preserve the tag order using the linked hash map
711        var map = new LinkedHashMap<ThrowsTree, ExecutableElement>();
712        for (var t : tags) {
713            var prev = map.put(t, holder);
714            assert prev == null; // there should be no equal exception tags
715        }
716        return map;
717    }
718
719    private List<ThrowsTree> findByTypeElement(Element targetExceptionType,
720            ExecutableElement executable)
721            throws Failure.ExceptionTypeNotFound,
722            Failure.NotExceptionType {
723        var result = new LinkedList<ThrowsTree>();
724        for (ThrowsTree t : utils.getThrowsTrees(executable)) {
725            Element candidate = getExceptionType(t, executable);
726            if (targetExceptionType.equals(candidate)) {
727                result.add(t);
728            }
729        }
730        return List.copyOf(result);
731    }
732
733    /*
734     * An exception section (that is, the "Throws:" section in the Method
735     * or Constructor Details section) builder.
736     *
737     * The section is being built sequentially from top to bottom.
738     *
739     * Adapts one-off methods of writer to continuous building.
740     */
741    private static class ExceptionSectionBuilder {
742
743        private final TagletWriter writer;
744        private final Content result;
745        private ContentBuilder current;
746        private boolean began;
747        private boolean headerAdded;
748        private TypeMirror exceptionType;
749
750        ExceptionSectionBuilder(TagletWriter writer) {
751            this.writer = writer;
752            this.result = writer.getOutputInstance();
753        }
754
755        void beginEntry(TypeMirror exceptionType) {
756            if (began) {
757                throw new IllegalStateException();
758            }
759            began = true;
760            current = new ContentBuilder();
761            this.exceptionType = exceptionType;
762        }
763
764        void continueEntry(Content c) {
765            if (!began) {
766                throw new IllegalStateException();
767            }
768            current.add(c);
769        }
770
771        public void endEntry() {
772            if (!began) {
773                throw new IllegalStateException();
774            }
775            began = false;
776            if (!headerAdded) {
777                headerAdded = true;
778                result.add(writer.getThrowsHeader());
779            }
780            result.add(writer.throwsTagOutput(exceptionType,
781                current.isEmpty() ? Optional.empty() : Optional.of(current)));
782            current = null;
783        }
784
785        Content build() {
786            return result;
787        }
788
789        // for debugging purposes only
790        boolean debugEntryBegun() {
791            return began;
792        }
793    }
794
795    /**
796     * Returns a map of substitutions for a list of thrown types with the original type-variable
797     * as a key and the instantiated type as a value. If no types need to be substituted
798     * an empty map is returned.
799     * @param declaredThrownTypes the originally declared thrown types.
800     * @param instantiatedThrownTypes the thrown types in the context of the current type.
801     * @return map of declared to instantiated thrown types or an empty map.
802     */
803    private Map<TypeMirror, TypeMirror> getSubstitutedThrownTypes(Types types,
804            List<? extends TypeMirror> declaredThrownTypes,
805            List<? extends TypeMirror> instantiatedThrownTypes) {
806        Map<TypeMirror, TypeMirror> map = new HashMap<>();
807        var i1 = declaredThrownTypes.iterator();
808        var i2 = instantiatedThrownTypes.iterator();
809        while (i1.hasNext() && i2.hasNext()) {
810            TypeMirror t1 = i1.next();
811            TypeMirror t2 = i2.next();
812            if (!types.isSameType(t1, t2)) {
813                map.put(t1, t2);
814            }
815        }
816        // correspondence between types is established positionally, i.e.
817        // pairwise, which means that the lists must have the same
818        // number of elements; if they don't, this algorithm is
819        // broken
820        assert !i1.hasNext() && !i2.hasNext();
821        // copyOf is unordered and this is fine: this map is for queries;
822        // it doesn't control rendering order
823        return Map.copyOf(map);
824    }
825
826    private static AssertionError newAssertionError(Object... objects) {
827        return new AssertionError(Arrays.toString(objects));
828    }
829
830    private static String diagnosticDescriptionOf(Element e) {
831        var name = e instanceof QualifiedNameable q ? q.getQualifiedName()
832            : e.getSimpleName();
833        return name + " (" + detailedDescriptionOf(e) + ")";
834    }
835
836    private static String detailedDescriptionOf(Element e) {
837        // It might be important to describe the element in detail. Sometimes
838        // elements share the same simple and/or qualified name. Outputting
839        // individual components of that name as well as their kinds helps
840        // the user disambiguate such elements.
841        var lowerCasedKind = e.getKind().toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
842        var thisElementDescription
843            = lowerCasedKind + " " + switch (e.getKind()) {
844            // A package is never enclosed in a package and a module is
845            // never never enclosed in a module, no matter what their
846            // qualified name might suggest. Get their qualified
847            // name directly. Also, unnamed packages and
848            // modules require special treatment.
849            case PACKAGE -> {
850                var p = (PackageElement) e;
851                // might use i18n in the future
852                yield p.isUnnamed() ? "<unnamed package>"
853                    : p.getQualifiedName();
854            }
855            case MODULE -> {
856                var m = (ModuleElement) e;
857                // might use i18n in the future, if there's value in displaying
858                // an unnamed module
859                yield m.isUnnamed() ? "<unnamed module>" : m.getQualifiedName();
860            }
861            default -> e.getSimpleName();
862            };
863        if (e.getEnclosingElement() == null) {
864            return thisElementDescription;
865        }
866        var enclosingElementDescription
867            = detailedDescriptionOf(e.getEnclosingElement());
868        return enclosingElementDescription + " " + thisElementDescription;
869    }
870}
